==Criticism and controversies==
The election was criticised as being a "sham."<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2010/11/20101117115630882819.html How to win power in Egypt - Features - Al Jazeera English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>

===State of Emergency===
  +
{{expand section|date=November 2010}}
  +
President Mubarak promised in 2005 that he would put in place a counter terrorism law that would obviate the need for the state of emergency that has been in place continuously since Sadatâs assassination in 1981<ref name="Time to Pursue Democracy in Egypt">[http://carnegieendowment.org/files/Dunne_Egypt_FINAL2.pdf Time to Pursue Democracy in Egypt]</ref>. But in 2010, he renewed the state of emergency. The Egyptian government has long claimed that such powers are used only against suspected terrorists and drug dealers but in fact they have also been used against nonviolent political opponents of the regime<ref name="Time to Pursue Democracy in Egypt" />.
